remarks.format:
## 解説 The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> class when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> is drawn and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.OwnerDraw%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value is **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** . The handler for this event receives a parameter of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs> class contains all the information needed to paint the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>, including the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> text, the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>, and the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object on which the drawing should be done. To customize the look of the ToolTip, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle> to determine the bounds of the ToolTip, and the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to perform your customized drawing. You can increase the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> before it is shown by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup> event.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs> also supports partial customization through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawBackground%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawText%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawBorder%2A> methods. Using these methods, you can owner draw portions of the ToolTip while leaving the other portions drawn in the standard way.
## 例 The following code example demonstrates how to custom draw the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>. The example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> and associates it to three <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> controls located on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. The example sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.OwnerDraw%2A> property to true and handles the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw> event. In the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw> event handler, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> is custom drawn differently depending on what button the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> is being displayed for as indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.AssociatedControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
